 33 /*global JXG: true, define: true*/

 36 /* depends:

 51 /**
 52  * @fileoverview In this file the geometry element Curve is defined.
 53  */
 54 
 55 define([
 56     'jxg', 'base/constants', 'base/coords', 'base/element', 'math/math', 'math/statistics', 'math/numerics',
 57     'math/geometry', 'parser/geonext', 'utils/type', 'base/transformation', 'math/qdt'
 58 ], function (JXG, Const, Coords, GeometryElement, Mat, Statistics, Numerics, Geometry, GeonextParser, Type, Transform, QDT) {
 59 
 60     "use strict";
 61 
 62     /**
 63      * Curves are the common object for function graphs, parametric curves, polar curves, and data plots.
 64      * @class Creates a new curve object. Do not use this constructor to create a curve. Use {@link JXG.Board#create} with
 65      * type {@link Curve}, or {@link Functiongraph} instead.
 66      * @augments JXG.GeometryElement
 67      * @param {String|JXG.Board} board The board the new curve is drawn on.
 68      * @param {Array} parents defining terms An array with the functon terms or the data points of the curve.
 69      * @param {Object} attributes Defines the visual appearance of the curve.
 70      * @see JXG.Board#generateName
 71      * @see JXG.Board#addCurve
 72      */
 73     JXG.Curve = function (board, parents, attributes) {
 74         this.constructor(board, attributes, Const.OBJECT_TYPE_CURVE, Const.OBJECT_CLASS_CURVE);
 75 
 76         this.points = [];
 77         /**
 78          * Number of points on curves. This value changes
 79          * between numberPointsLow and numberPointsHigh.
 80          * It is set in {@link JXG.Curve#updateCurve}.
 81          */
 82         this.numberPoints = Type.evaluate(this.visProp.numberpointshigh);
 83 
 84         this.bezierDegree = 1;
 85 
 86         /**
 87          * Array holding the x-coordinates of a data plot.
 88          * This array can be updated during run time by overwriting
 89          * the method {@link JXG.Curve#updateDataArray}.
 90          * @type {array}
 91          */
 92         this.dataX = null;
 93 
 94         /**
 95          * Array holding the y-coordinates of a data plot.
 96          * This array can be updated during run time by overwriting
 97          * the method {@link JXG.Curve#updateDataArray}.
 98          * @type {array}
 99          */
100         this.dataY = null;
101 
102         /**
103          * Stores a quad tree if it is required. The quad tree is generated in the curve
104          * updates and can be used to speed up the hasPoint method.
105          * @type {JXG.Math.Quadtree}
106          */
107         this.qdt = null;
108 
109         if (Type.exists(parents[0])) {
110             this.varname = parents[0];
111         } else {
112             this.varname = 'x';
113         }
114 
115         // function graphs: "x"
116         this.xterm = parents[1];
117         // function graphs: e.g. "x^2"
118         this.yterm = parents[2];
119 
120         // Converts GEONExT syntax into JavaScript syntax
121         this.generateTerm(this.varname, this.xterm, this.yterm, parents[3], parents[4]);
122         // First evaluation of the curve
123         this.updateCurve();
124 
125         this.id = this.board.setId(this, 'G');
126         this.board.renderer.drawCurve(this);
127 
128         this.board.finalizeAdding(this);
129 
130         this.createGradient();
131         this.elType = 'curve';
132         this.createLabel();
133 
134         if (Type.isString(this.xterm)) {
135             this.notifyParents(this.xterm);
136         }
137         if (Type.isString(this.yterm)) {
138             this.notifyParents(this.yterm);
139         }
140 
141         this.methodMap = Type.deepCopy(this.methodMap, {
142             generateTerm: 'generateTerm',
143             setTerm: 'generateTerm',
144             move: 'moveTo',
145             moveTo: 'moveTo'
146         });
147     };
148 
149     JXG.Curve.prototype = new GeometryElement();
150 
151     JXG.extend(JXG.Curve.prototype, /** @lends JXG.Curve.prototype */ {
152 
153         /**
154          * Gives the default value of the left bound for the curve.
155          * May be overwritten in {@link JXG.Curve#generateTerm}.
156          * @returns {Number} Left bound for the curve.
157          */
158         minX: function () {
159             var leftCoords;
160 
161             if (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.curvetype) === 'polar') {
162                 return 0;
163             }
164 
165             leftCoords = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, [0, 0], this.board, false);
166             return leftCoords.usrCoords[1];
167         },
168 
169         /**
170          * Gives the default value of the right bound for the curve.
171          * May be overwritten in {@link JXG.Curve#generateTerm}.
172          * @returns {Number} Right bound for the curve.
173          */
174         maxX: function () {
175             var rightCoords;
176 
177             if (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.curvetype) === 'polar') {
178                 return 2 * Math.PI;
179             }
180             rightCoords = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, [this.board.canvasWidth, 0], this.board, false);
181 
182             return rightCoords.usrCoords[1];
183         },
184 
185         /**
186          * The parametric function which defines the x-coordinate of the curve.
187          * @param {Number} t A number between {@link JXG.Curve#minX} and {@link JXG.Curve#maxX}.
188          * @param {Boolean} suspendUpdate A boolean flag which is false for the
189          * first call of the function during a fresh plot of the curve and true
190          * for all subsequent calls of the function. This may be used to speed up the
191          * plotting of the curve, if the e.g. the curve depends on some input elements.
192          * @returns {Number} x-coordinate of the curve at t.
193          */
194         X: function (t) {
195             return NaN;
196         },
197         /**
198         * The parametric function which defines the y-coordinate of the curve.
199         * @param {Number} t A number between {@link JXG.Curve#minX} and {@link JXG.Curve#maxX}.
200         * @param {Boolean} suspendUpdate A boolean flag which is false for the
201         * first call of the function during a fresh plot of the curve and true
202         * for all subsequent calls of the function. This may be used to speed up the
203         * plotting of the curve, if the e.g. the curve depends on some input elements.
204         * @returns {Number} y-coordinate of the curve at t.
205          */
206         Y: function (t) {
207             return NaN;
208         },
209 
210         /**
211          * Treat the curve as curve with homogeneous coordinates.
212          * @param {Number} t A number between {@link JXG.Curve#minX} and {@link JXG.Curve#maxX}.
213          * @returns {Number} Always 1.0
214          */
215         Z: function (t) {
216             return 1;
217         },
218 
219         /**
220          * Checks whether (x,y) is near the curve.
221          * @param {Number} x Coordinate in x direction, screen coordinates.
222          * @param {Number} y Coordinate in y direction, screen coordinates.
223          * @param {Number} start Optional start index for search on data plots.
224          * @returns {Boolean} True if (x,y) is near the curve, False otherwise.
225          */
226         hasPoint: function (x, y, start) {
227             var t, checkPoint, len, invMat, c,
228                 i, tX, tY,
229                 res = [],
230                 points, qdt,
231                 steps = Type.evaluate(this.visProp.numberpointslow),
232                 d = (this.maxX() - this.minX()) / steps,
233                 prec = this.board.options.precision.hasPoint,
234                 dist = Infinity,
235                 ux2, uy2,
236                 ev_ct,
237                 suspendUpdate = true;
238 
239             checkPoint = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, [x, y], this.board, false);
240             x = checkPoint.usrCoords[1];
241             y = checkPoint.usrCoords[2];
242 
243             // We use usrCoords. Only in the final distance calculation
244             // screen coords are used
245             prec += Type.evaluate(this.visProp.strokewidth) * 0.5;
246             prec *= prec; // We do not want to take sqrt
247             ux2 = this.board.unitX * this.board.unitX;
248             uy2 = this.board.unitY * this.board.unitY;
249 
250 
251             ev_ct = Type.evaluate(this.visProp.curvetype);
252             if (ev_ct === 'parameter' || ev_ct === 'polar') {
253                 if (this.transformations.length > 0) {
254                     /**
255                      * Transform the mouse/touch coordinates
256                      * back to the original position of the curve.
257                      */
258                     this.updateTransformMatrix();
259                     invMat = Mat.inverse(this.transformMat);
260                     c = Mat.matVecMult(invMat, [1, x, y]);
261                     x = c[1];
262                     y = c[2];
263                 }
264 
265                 // Brute force search for a point on the curve close to the mouse pointer
266                 for (i = 0, t = this.minX(); i < steps; i++) {
267                     tX = this.X(t, suspendUpdate);
268                     tY = this.Y(t, suspendUpdate);
269 
270                     dist = (x - tX) * (x - tX) * ux2 + (y - tY) * (y - tY) * uy2;
271 
272                     if (dist <= prec) {
273                         return true;
274                     }
275 
276                     t += d;
277                 }
278             } else if (ev_ct === 'plot' ||
279                         ev_ct === 'functiongraph') {
280 
281                 if (!Type.exists(start) || start < 0) {
282                     start = 0;
283                 }
284 
285                 if (Type.exists(this.qdt) && Type.evaluate(this.visProp.useqdt) && this.bezierDegree !== 3) {
286                     qdt = this.qdt.query(new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [x, y], this.board));
287                     points = qdt.points;
288                     len = points.length;
289                 } else {
290                     points = this.points;
291                     len = this.numberPoints - 1;
292                 }
293 
294                 for (i = start; i < len; i++) {
295                     if (this.bezierDegree === 3) {
296                         res.push(Geometry.projectCoordsToBeziersegment([1, x, y], this, i));
297                     } else {
298                         if (qdt) {
299                             if (points[i].prev) {
300                                 res = Geometry.projectCoordsToSegment(
301                                     [1, x, y],
302                                     points[i].prev.usrCoords,
303                                     points[i].usrCoords
304                                 );
305                             }
306 
307                             // If the next point in the array is the same as the current points
308                             // next neighbor we don't have to project it onto that segment because
309                             // that will already be done in the next iteration of this loop.
310                             if (points[i].next && points[i + 1] !== points[i].next) {
311                                 res = Geometry.projectCoordsToSegment(
312                                     [1, x, y],
313                                     points[i].usrCoords,
314                                     points[i].next.usrCoords
315                                 );
316                             }
317                         } else {
318                             res = Geometry.projectCoordsToSegment(
319                                 [1, x, y],
320                                 points[i].usrCoords,
321                                 points[i + 1].usrCoords
322                             );
323                         }
324                     }
325 
326                     if (res[1] >= 0 && res[1] <= 1 &&
327                         (x - res[0][1]) * (x - res[0][1]) * ux2 +
328                         (y - res[0][2]) * (y - res[0][2]) * uy2 <= prec) {
329                         return true;
330                     }
331                 }
332                 return false;
333             }
334             return (dist < prec);
335         },
336 
337         /**
338          * Allocate points in the Coords array this.points
339          */
340         allocatePoints: function () {
341             var i, len;
342 
343             len = this.numberPoints;
344 
345             if (this.points.length < this.numberPoints) {
346                 for (i = this.points.length; i < len; i++) {
347                     this.points[i] = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [0, 0], this.board, false);
348                 }
349             }
350         },
351 
352         /**
353          * Computes for equidistant points on the x-axis the values of the function
354          * @returns {JXG.Curve} Reference to the curve object.
355          * @see JXG.Curve#updateCurve
356          */
357         update: function () {
358             if (this.needsUpdate) {
359                 if (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.trace)) {
360                     this.cloneToBackground(true);
361                 }
362                 this.updateCurve();
363             }
364 
365             return this;
366         },
367 
368         /**
369          * Updates the visual contents of the curve.
370          * @returns {JXG.Curve} Reference to the curve object.
371          */
372         updateRenderer: function () {
373             //var wasReal;
374 
375             if (!this.needsUpdate) {
376                 return this;
377             }
378 
379             if (this.visPropCalc.visible) {
380                 // wasReal = this.isReal;
381 
382                 this.checkReal();
383 
384                 if (//wasReal &&
385                     !this.isReal) {
386                     this.updateVisibility(false);
387                 }
388             }
389 
390             if (this.visPropCalc.visible) {
391                 this.board.renderer.updateCurve(this);
392             }
393 
394             /* Update the label if visible. */
395             if (this.hasLabel && this.visPropCalc.visible && this.label &&
396                 this.label.visPropCalc.visible && this.isReal) {
397 
398                 this.label.update();
399                 this.board.renderer.updateText(this.label);
400             }
401 
402             // Update rendNode display
403             this.setDisplayRendNode();
404             // if (this.visPropCalc.visible !== this.visPropOld.visible) {
405             //     this.board.renderer.display(this, this.visPropCalc.visible);
406             //     this.visPropOld.visible = this.visPropCalc.visible;
407             //
408             //     if (this.hasLabel) {
409             //         this.board.renderer.display(this.label, this.label.visPropCalc.visible);
410             //     }
411             // }
412 
413             this.needsUpdate = false;
414             return this;
415         },
416 
417         /**
418          * For dynamic dataplots updateCurve can be used to compute new entries
419          * for the arrays {@link JXG.Curve#dataX} and {@link JXG.Curve#dataY}. It
420          * is used in {@link JXG.Curve#updateCurve}. Default is an empty method, can
421          * be overwritten by the user.
422          *
423          *
424          * @example
425          * // This example overwrites the updateDataArray method.
426          * // There, new values for the arrays JXG.Curve.dataX and JXG.Curve.dataY
427          * // are computed from the value of the slider N
428          *
429          * var N = board.create('slider', [[0,1.5],[3,1.5],[1,3,40]], {name:'n',snapWidth:1});
430          * var circ = board.create('circle',[[4,-1.5],1],{strokeWidth:1, strokecolor:'black', strokeWidth:2,
431          * 		fillColor:'#0055ff13'});
432          *
433          * var c = board.create('curve', [[0],[0]],{strokecolor:'red', strokeWidth:2});
434          * c.updateDataArray = function() {
435          *         var r = 1, n = Math.floor(N.Value()),
436          *             x = [0], y = [0],
437          *             phi = Math.PI/n,
438          *             h = r*Math.cos(phi),
439          *             s = r*Math.sin(phi),
440          *             i, j,
441          *             px = 0, py = 0, sgn = 1,
442          *             d = 16,
443          *             dt = phi/d,
444          *             pt;
445          *
446          *         for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
447          *             for (j = -d; j <= d; j++) {
448          *                 pt = dt*j;
449          *                 x.push(px + r*Math.sin(pt));
450          *                 y.push(sgn*r*Math.cos(pt) - (sgn-1)*h*0.5);
451          *             }
452          *             px += s;
453          *             sgn *= (-1);
454          *         }
455          *         x.push((n - 1)*s);
456          *         y.push(h + (sgn - 1)*h*0.5);
457          *         this.dataX = x;
458          *         this.dataY = y;
459          *     }
460          *
461          * var c2 = board.create('curve', [[0],[0]],{strokecolor:'red', strokeWidth:1});
462          * c2.updateDataArray = function() {
463          *         var r = 1, n = Math.floor(N.Value()),
464          *             px = circ.midpoint.X(), py = circ.midpoint.Y(),
465          *             x = [px], y = [py],
466          *             phi = Math.PI/n,
467          *             s = r*Math.sin(phi),
468          *             i, j,
469          *             d = 16,
470          *             dt = phi/d,
471          *             pt = Math.PI*0.5+phi;
472          *
473          *         for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
474          *             for (j= -d; j <= d; j++) {
475          *                 x.push(px + r*Math.cos(pt));
476          *                 y.push(py + r*Math.sin(pt));
477          *                 pt -= dt;
478          *             }
479          *             x.push(px);
480          *             y.push(py);
481          *             pt += dt;
482          *         }
483          *         this.dataX = x;
484          *         this.dataY = y;
485          *     }
486          *     board.update();
487          *
488          * </pre><div id="20bc7802-e69e-11e5-b1bf-901b0e1b8723" class="jxgbox" style="width: 600px; height: 400px;"></div>
489          * <script type="text/javascript">
490          *     (function() {
491          *         var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('20bc7802-e69e-11e5-b1bf-901b0e1b8723',
492          *             {boundingbox: [-1.5,2,8,-3], keepaspectratio: true, axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
493          *             var N = board.create('slider', [[0,1.5],[3,1.5],[1,3,40]], {name:'n',snapWidth:1});
494          *             var circ = board.create('circle',[[4,-1.5],1],{strokeWidth:1, strokecolor:'black',
495          *             strokeWidth:2, fillColor:'#0055ff13'});
496          *
497          *             var c = board.create('curve', [[0],[0]],{strokecolor:'red', strokeWidth:2});
498          *             c.updateDataArray = function() {
499          *                     var r = 1, n = Math.floor(N.Value()),
500          *                         x = [0], y = [0],
501          *                         phi = Math.PI/n,
502          *                         h = r*Math.cos(phi),
503          *                         s = r*Math.sin(phi),
504          *                         i, j,
505          *                         px = 0, py = 0, sgn = 1,
506          *                         d = 16,
507          *                         dt = phi/d,
508          *                         pt;
509          *
510          *                     for (i=0;i<n;i++) {
511          *                         for (j=-d;j<=d;j++) {
512          *                             pt = dt*j;
513          *                             x.push(px+r*Math.sin(pt));
514          *                             y.push(sgn*r*Math.cos(pt)-(sgn-1)*h*0.5);
515          *                         }
516          *                         px += s;
517          *                         sgn *= (-1);
518          *                     }
519          *                     x.push((n-1)*s);
520          *                     y.push(h+(sgn-1)*h*0.5);
521          *                     this.dataX = x;
522          *                     this.dataY = y;
523          *                 }
524          *
525          *             var c2 = board.create('curve', [[0],[0]],{strokecolor:'red', strokeWidth:1});
526          *             c2.updateDataArray = function() {
527          *                     var r = 1, n = Math.floor(N.Value()),
528          *                         px = circ.midpoint.X(), py = circ.midpoint.Y(),
529          *                         x = [px], y = [py],
530          *                         phi = Math.PI/n,
531          *                         s = r*Math.sin(phi),
532          *                         i, j,
533          *                         d = 16,
534          *                         dt = phi/d,
535          *                         pt = Math.PI*0.5+phi;
536          *
537          *                     for (i=0;i<n;i++) {
538          *                         for (j=-d;j<=d;j++) {
539          *                             x.push(px+r*Math.cos(pt));
540          *                             y.push(py+r*Math.sin(pt));
541          *                             pt -= dt;
542          *                         }
543          *                         x.push(px);
544          *                         y.push(py);
545          *                         pt += dt;
546          *                     }
547          *                     this.dataX = x;
548          *                     this.dataY = y;
549          *                 }
550          *                 board.update();
551          *
552          *     })();
553          *
554          * </script><pre>
555          *
556          * @example
557          * // This is an example which overwrites updateDataArray and produces
558          * // a Bezier curve of degree three.
559          * var A = board.create('point', [-3,3]);
560          * var B = board.create('point', [3,-2]);
561          * var line = board.create('segment', [A,B]);
562          *
563          * var height = 0.5; // height of the curly brace
564          *
565          * // Curly brace
566          * var crl = board.create('curve', [[0],[0]], {strokeWidth:1, strokeColor:'black'});
567          * crl.bezierDegree = 3;
568          * crl.updateDataArray = function() {
569          *     var d = [B.X()-A.X(), B.Y()-A.Y()],
570          *         dl = Math.sqrt(d[0]*d[0]+d[1]*d[1]),
571          *         mid = [(A.X()+B.X())*0.5, (A.Y()+B.Y())*0.5];
572          *
573          *     d[0] *= height/dl;
574          *     d[1] *= height/dl;
575          *
576          *     this.dataX = [ A.X(), A.X()-d[1], mid[0], mid[0]-d[1], mid[0], B.X()-d[1], B.X() ];
577          *     this.dataY = [ A.Y(), A.Y()+d[0], mid[1], mid[1]+d[0], mid[1], B.Y()+d[0], B.Y() ];
578          * };
579          *
580          * // Text
581          * var txt = board.create('text', [
582          *                     function() {
583          *                         var d = [B.X()-A.X(), B.Y()-A.Y()],
584          *                             dl = Math.sqrt(d[0]*d[0]+d[1]*d[1]),
585          *                             mid = (A.X()+B.X())*0.5;
586          *
587          *                         d[1] *= height/dl;
588          *                         return mid-d[1]+0.1;
589          *                     },
590          *                     function() {
591          *                         var d = [B.X()-A.X(), B.Y()-A.Y()],
592          *                             dl = Math.sqrt(d[0]*d[0]+d[1]*d[1]),
593          *                             mid = (A.Y()+B.Y())*0.5;
594          *
595          *                         d[0] *= height/dl;
596          *                         return mid+d[0]+0.1;
597          *                     },
598          *                     function() { return "length=" + JXG.toFixed(B.Dist(A), 2); }
599          *                 ]);
600          *
601          *
602          * board.update(); // This update is necessary to call updateDataArray the first time.
603          *
604          * </pre><div id="a61a4d66-e69f-11e5-b1bf-901b0e1b8723"  class="jxgbox" style="width: 300px; height: 300px;"></div>
605          * <script type="text/javascript">
606          *     (function() {
607          *      var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('a61a4d66-e69f-11e5-b1bf-901b0e1b8723',
608          *             {boundingbox: [-4, 4, 4,-4], axis: true, showcopyright: false, shownavigation: false});
609          *     var A = board.create('point', [-3,3]);
610          *     var B = board.create('point', [3,-2]);
611          *     var line = board.create('segment', [A,B]);
612          *
613          *     var height = 0.5; // height of the curly brace
614          *
615          *     // Curly brace
616          *     var crl = board.create('curve', [[0],[0]], {strokeWidth:1, strokeColor:'black'});
617          *     crl.bezierDegree = 3;
618          *     crl.updateDataArray = function() {
619          *         var d = [B.X()-A.X(), B.Y()-A.Y()],
620          *             dl = Math.sqrt(d[0]*d[0]+d[1]*d[1]),
621          *             mid = [(A.X()+B.X())*0.5, (A.Y()+B.Y())*0.5];
622          *
623          *         d[0] *= height/dl;
624          *         d[1] *= height/dl;
625          *
626          *         this.dataX = [ A.X(), A.X()-d[1], mid[0], mid[0]-d[1], mid[0], B.X()-d[1], B.X() ];
627          *         this.dataY = [ A.Y(), A.Y()+d[0], mid[1], mid[1]+d[0], mid[1], B.Y()+d[0], B.Y() ];
628          *     };
629          *
630          *     // Text
631          *     var txt = board.create('text', [
632          *                         function() {
633          *                             var d = [B.X()-A.X(), B.Y()-A.Y()],
634          *                                 dl = Math.sqrt(d[0]*d[0]+d[1]*d[1]),
635          *                                 mid = (A.X()+B.X())*0.5;
636          *
637          *                             d[1] *= height/dl;
638          *                             return mid-d[1]+0.1;
639          *                         },
640          *                         function() {
641          *                             var d = [B.X()-A.X(), B.Y()-A.Y()],
642          *                                 dl = Math.sqrt(d[0]*d[0]+d[1]*d[1]),
643          *                                 mid = (A.Y()+B.Y())*0.5;
644          *
645          *                             d[0] *= height/dl;
646          *                             return mid+d[0]+0.1;
647          *                         },
648          *                         function() { return "length="+JXG.toFixed(B.Dist(A), 2); }
649          *                     ]);
650          *
651          *
652          *     board.update(); // This update is necessary to call updateDataArray the first time.
653          *
654          *     })();
655          *
656          * </script><pre>
657          *
658          *
659          */
660         updateDataArray: function () {
661             // this used to return this, but we shouldn't rely on the user to implement it.
662         },
663 
664         /**
665          * Computes for equidistant points on the x-axis the values
666          * of the function.
667          * If the mousemove event triggers this update, we use only few
668          * points. Otherwise, e.g. on mouseup, many points are used.
669          * @see JXG.Curve#update
670          * @returns {JXG.Curve} Reference to the curve object.
671          */
672         updateCurve: function () {
673             var len, mi, ma, x, y, i,
674                 //t1, t2, l1,
675                 suspendUpdate = false;
676 
677             this.updateTransformMatrix();
678             this.updateDataArray();
679             mi = this.minX();
680             ma = this.maxX();
681 
682             // Discrete data points
683             // x-coordinates are in an array
684             if (Type.exists(this.dataX)) {
685                 this.numberPoints = this.dataX.length;
686                 len = this.numberPoints;
687 
688                 // It is possible, that the array length has increased.
689                 this.allocatePoints();
690 
691                 for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
692                     x = i;
693 
694                     // y-coordinates are in an array
695                     if (Type.exists(this.dataY)) {
696                         y = i;
697                         // The last parameter prevents rounding in usr2screen().
698                         this.points[i].setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.dataX[i], this.dataY[i]], false);
699                     } else {
700                         // discrete x data, continuous y data
701                         y = this.X(x);
702                         // The last parameter prevents rounding in usr2screen().
703                         this.points[i].setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.dataX[i], this.Y(y, suspendUpdate)], false);
704                     }
705                     this.points[i]._t = i;
706 
707                     this.updateTransform(this.points[i]);
708                     suspendUpdate = true;
709                 }
710             // continuous x data
711             } else {
712                 if (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.doadvancedplot)) {
713                     this.updateParametricCurve(mi, ma);
714                 } else if (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.doadvancedplotold)) {
715                     this.updateParametricCurveOld(mi, ma);
716                 } else {
717                     if (this.board.updateQuality === this.board.BOARD_QUALITY_HIGH) {
718                         this.numberPoints = Type.evaluate(this.visProp.numberpointshigh);
719                     } else {
720                         this.numberPoints = Type.evaluate(this.visProp.numberpointslow);
721                     }
722 
723                     // It is possible, that the array length has increased.
724                     this.allocatePoints();
725                     this.updateParametricCurveNaive(mi, ma, this.numberPoints);
726                 }
727                 len = this.numberPoints;
728 
729                 if (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.useqdt) &&
730                     this.board.updateQuality === this.board.BOARD_QUALITY_HIGH) {
731                     this.qdt = new QDT(this.board.getBoundingBox());
732                     for (i = 0; i < this.points.length; i++) {
733                         this.qdt.insert(this.points[i]);
734 
735                         if (i > 0) {
736                             this.points[i].prev = this.points[i - 1];
737                         }
738 
739                         if (i < len - 1) {
740                             this.points[i].next = this.points[i + 1];
741                         }
742                     }
743                 }
744 
745                 for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
746                     this.updateTransform(this.points[i]);
747                 }
748             }
749 
750             if (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.curvetype) !== 'plot' &&
751                     Type.evaluate(this.visProp.rdpsmoothing)) {
752                 this.points = Numerics.RamerDouglasPeucker(this.points, 0.2);
753                 this.numberPoints = this.points.length;
754             }
755 
756             return this;
757         },
758 
759         updateTransformMatrix: function () {
760             var t, i,
761                 len = this.transformations.length;
762 
763             this.transformMat = [[1, 0, 0], [0, 1, 0], [0, 0, 1]];
764 
765             for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
766                 t = this.transformations[i];
767                 t.update();
768                 this.transformMat = Mat.matMatMult(t.matrix, this.transformMat);
769             }
770 
771             return this;
772         },
773 
774         /**
775          * Check if at least one point on the curve is finite and real.
776          **/
777         checkReal: function () {
778             var b = false, i, p,
779                 len = this.numberPoints;
780 
781             for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
782                 p = this.points[i].usrCoords;
783                 if (!isNaN(p[1]) && !isNaN(p[2]) && Math.abs(p[0]) > Mat.eps) {
784                     b = true;
785                     break;
786                 }
787             }
788             this.isReal = b;
789         },
790 
791         /**
792          * Updates the data points of a parametric curve. This version is used if {@link JXG.Curve#doadvancedplot} is <tt>false</tt>.
793          * @param {Number} mi Left bound of curve
794          * @param {Number} ma Right bound of curve
795          * @param {Number} len Number of data points
796          * @returns {JXG.Curve} Reference to the curve object.
797          */
798         updateParametricCurveNaive: function (mi, ma, len) {
799             var i, t,
800                 suspendUpdate = false,
801                 stepSize = (ma - mi) / len;
802 
803             for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
804                 t = mi + i * stepSize;
805                 // The last parameter prevents rounding in usr2screen().
806                 this.points[i].setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(t, suspendUpdate), this.Y(t, suspendUpdate)], false);
807                 this.points[i]._t = t;
808                 suspendUpdate = true;
809             }
810             return this;
811         },
812 
813         /**
814          * Updates the data points of a parametric curve. This version is used if {@link JXG.Curve#doadvancedplot} is <tt>true</tt>.
815          * Since 0.99 this algorithm is deprecated. It still can be used if {@link JXG.Curve#doadvancedplotold} is <tt>true</tt>.
816          *
817          * @deprecated
818          * @param {Number} mi Left bound of curve
819          * @param {Number} ma Right bound of curve
820          * @returns {JXG.Curve} Reference to the curve object.
821          */
822         updateParametricCurveOld: function (mi, ma) {
823             var i, t, d,
824                 x, y, x0, y0, top, depth,
825                 MAX_DEPTH, MAX_XDIST, MAX_YDIST,
826                 suspendUpdate = false,
827                 po = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [0, 0], this.board, false),
828                 dyadicStack = [],
829                 depthStack = [],
830                 pointStack = [],
831                 divisors = [],
832                 distOK = false,
833                 j = 0,
834                 distFromLine = function (p1, p2, p0) {
835                     var lbda, d,
836                         x0 = p0[1] - p1[1],
837                         y0 = p0[2] - p1[2],
838                         x1 = p2[0] - p1[1],
839                         y1 = p2[1] - p1[2],
840                         den = x1 * x1 + y1 * y1;
841 
842                     if (den >= Mat.eps) {
843                         lbda = (x0 * x1 + y0 * y1) / den;
844                         if (lbda > 0) {
845                             if (lbda <= 1) {
846                                 x0 -= lbda * x1;
847                                 y0 -= lbda * y1;
848                             // lbda = 1.0;
849                             } else {
850                                 x0 -= x1;
851                                 y0 -= y1;
852                             }
853                         }
854                     }
855                     d = x0 * x0 + y0 * y0;
856                     return Math.sqrt(d);
857                 };
858 
859             JXG.deprecated('Curve.updateParametricCurveOld()');
860 
861             if (this.board.updateQuality === this.board.BOARD_QUALITY_LOW) {
862                 MAX_DEPTH = 15;
863                 MAX_XDIST = 10; // 10
864                 MAX_YDIST = 10; // 10
865             } else {
866                 MAX_DEPTH = 21;
867                 MAX_XDIST = 0.7; // 0.7
868                 MAX_YDIST = 0.7; // 0.7
869             }
870 
871             divisors[0] = ma - mi;
872             for (i = 1; i < MAX_DEPTH; i++) {
873                 divisors[i] = divisors[i - 1] * 0.5;
874             }
875 
876             i = 1;
877             dyadicStack[0] = 1;
878             depthStack[0] = 0;
879 
880             t = mi;
881             po.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(t, suspendUpdate), this.Y(t, suspendUpdate)], false);
882 
883             // Now, there was a first call to the functions defining the curve.
884             // Defining elements like sliders have been evaluated.
885             // Therefore, we can set suspendUpdate to false, so that these defining elements
886             // need not be evaluated anymore for the rest of the plotting.
887             suspendUpdate = true;
888             x0 = po.scrCoords[1];
889             y0 = po.scrCoords[2];
890             t0 = t;
891 
892             t = ma;
893             po.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(t, suspendUpdate), this.Y(t, suspendUpdate)], false);
894             x = po.scrCoords[1];
895             y = po.scrCoords[2];
896 
897             pointStack[0] = [x, y];
898 
899             top = 1;
900             depth = 0;
901 
902             this.points = [];
903             this.points[j++] = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, [x0, y0], this.board, false);
904 
905             do {
906                 distOK = this.isDistOK(x - x0, y - y0, MAX_XDIST, MAX_YDIST) || this.isSegmentOutside(x0, y0, x, y);
907                 while (depth < MAX_DEPTH && (!distOK || depth < 6) && (depth <= 7 || this.isSegmentDefined(x0, y0, x, y))) {
908                     // We jump out of the loop if
909                     // * depth>=MAX_DEPTH or
910                     // * (depth>=6 and distOK) or
911                     // * (depth>7 and segment is not defined)
912 
913                     dyadicStack[top] = i;
914                     depthStack[top] = depth;
915                     pointStack[top] = [x, y];
916                     top += 1;
917 
918                     i = 2 * i - 1;
919                     // Here, depth is increased and may reach MAX_DEPTH
920                     depth++;
921                     // In that case, t is undefined and we will see a jump in the curve.
922                     t = mi + i * divisors[depth];
923 
924                     po.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(t, suspendUpdate), this.Y(t, suspendUpdate)], false, true);
925                     x = po.scrCoords[1];
926                     y = po.scrCoords[2];
927                     distOK = this.isDistOK(x - x0, y - y0, MAX_XDIST, MAX_YDIST) || this.isSegmentOutside(x0, y0, x, y);
928                 }
929 
930                 if (j > 1) {
931                     d = distFromLine(this.points[j - 2].scrCoords, [x, y], this.points[j - 1].scrCoords);
932                     if (d < 0.015) {
933                         j -= 1;
934                     }
935                 }
936 
937                 this.points[j] = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, [x, y], this.board, false);
938                 this.points[j]._t = t;
939                 j += 1;
940 
941                 x0 = x;
942                 y0 = y;
943                 t0 = t;
944 
945                 top -= 1;
946                 x = pointStack[top][0];
947                 y = pointStack[top][1];
948                 depth = depthStack[top] + 1;
949                 i = dyadicStack[top] * 2;
950 
951             } while (top > 0 && j < 500000);
952 
953             this.numberPoints = this.points.length;
954 
955             return this;
956         },
957 
958         /**
959          * Crude and cheap test if the segment defined by the two points <tt>(x0, y0)</tt> and <tt>(x1, y1)</tt> is
960          * outside the viewport of the board. All parameters have to be given in screen coordinates.
961          *
962          * @private
963          * @param {Number} x0
964          * @param {Number} y0
965          * @param {Number} x1
966          * @param {Number} y1
967          * @returns {Boolean} <tt>true</tt> if the given segment is outside the visible area.
968          */
969         isSegmentOutside: function (x0, y0, x1, y1) {
970             return (y0 < 0 && y1 < 0) || (y0 > this.board.canvasHeight && y1 > this.board.canvasHeight) ||
971                 (x0 < 0 && x1 < 0) || (x0 > this.board.canvasWidth && x1 > this.board.canvasWidth);
972         },
973 
974         /**
975          * Compares the absolute value of <tt>dx</tt> with <tt>MAXX</tt> and the absolute value of <tt>dy</tt>
976          * with <tt>MAXY</tt>.
977          *
978          * @private
979          * @param {Number} dx
980          * @param {Number} dy
981          * @param {Number} MAXX
982          * @param {Number} MAXY
983          * @returns {Boolean} <tt>true</tt>, if <tt>|dx| < MAXX</tt> and <tt>|dy| < MAXY</tt>.
984          */
985         isDistOK: function (dx, dy, MAXX, MAXY) {
986             return (Math.abs(dx) < MAXX && Math.abs(dy) < MAXY) && !isNaN(dx + dy);
987         },
988 
989          /**
990          * @private
991          */
992         isSegmentDefined: function (x0, y0, x1, y1) {
993             return !(isNaN(x0 + y0) && isNaN(x1 + y1));
994         },
995 
996         /**
997          * Add a point to the curve plot. If the new point is too close to the previously inserted point,
998          * it is skipped.
999          * Used in {@link JXG.Curve._plotRecursive}.
1000          *
1001          * @private
1002          * @param {JXG.Coords} pnt Coords to add to the list of points
1003          */
1004         _insertPoint: function (pnt, t) {
1005             var lastReal = !isNaN(this._lastCrds[1] + this._lastCrds[2]),     // The last point was real
1006                 newReal = !isNaN(pnt.scrCoords[1] + pnt.scrCoords[2]),        // New point is real point
1007                 cw = this.board.canvasWidth,
1008                 ch = this.board.canvasHeight,
1009                 off = 500;
1010 
1011             newReal = newReal &&
1012                         (pnt.scrCoords[1] > -off && pnt.scrCoords[2] > -off &&
1013                          pnt.scrCoords[1] < cw + off && pnt.scrCoords[2] < ch + off);
1014 
1015             /*
1016              * Prevents two consecutive NaNs or points wich are too close
1017              */
1018             if ((!newReal && lastReal) ||
1019                     (newReal && (!lastReal ||
1020                         Math.abs(pnt.scrCoords[1] - this._lastCrds[1]) > 0.7 ||
1021                         Math.abs(pnt.scrCoords[2] - this._lastCrds[2]) > 0.7))) {
1022                 pnt._t = t;
1023                 this.points.push(pnt);
1024                 this._lastCrds = pnt.copy('scrCoords');
1025             }
1026         },
1027 
1028         /**
1029          * Find the intersection of the asymptote for e.g. a log function
1030          * with the canvas.
1031          * @private
1032          * @param  {Array} asymptote Asymptote line in standard form
1033          * @param  {Array} box       Bounding box of the canavs
1034          * @param  {Number} direction horizontal direction of the asymptote. If < 0 the asymptote
1035          *  goes to the left, otherwise to the right.
1036          * @returns {Array}           Homogeneous coordinate array of the intersection point.
1037          */
1038         _intersectWithBorder: function(asymptote, box, direction) {
1039             var border, intersection, x, y;
1040 
1041             if (direction <= 0) { // Intersect with left border
1042                 border = [-box[0], 1, 0];
1043                 intersection = Mat.crossProduct(border, asymptote);
1044                 if (intersection[0] !== 0.0) {
1045                     x = intersection[1] / intersection[0];
1046                     y = intersection[2] / intersection[0];
1047                 } else {
1048                     y = Infinity;
1049                 }
1050 
1051                 if (y < box[3]) { // Intersect with bottom border
1052                     border = [-box[3], 0, 1];
1053                     intersection = Mat.crossProduct(border, asymptote);
1054                     if (intersection[0] !== 0.0) {
1055                         x = intersection[1] / intersection[0];
1056                         y = intersection[2] / intersection[0];
1057                     } else {
1058                         x = Infinity;
1059                     }
1060                 } else if (y > box[1]) { // Intersect with top border
1061                     border = [-box[1], 0, 1];
1062                     intersection = Mat.crossProduct(border, asymptote);
1063                     if (intersection[0] !== 0.0) {
1064                         x = intersection[1] / intersection[0];
1065                         y = intersection[2] / intersection[0];
1066                     } else {
1067                         x = Infinity;
1068                     }
1069                 }
1070             } else { // Intersect with right border
1071                 border = [-box[2], 1, 0];
1072                 intersection = Mat.crossProduct(border, asymptote);
1073                 if (intersection[0] !== 0.0) {
1074                     x = intersection[1] / intersection[0];
1075                     y = intersection[2] / intersection[0];
1076                 } else {
1077                     y = Infinity;
1078                 }
1079 
1080                 if (y < box[3]) { // Intersect with bottom border
1081                     border = [-box[3], 0, 1];
1082                     intersection = Mat.crossProduct(border, asymptote);
1083                     if (intersection[0] !== 0.0) {
1084                         x = intersection[1] / intersection[0];
1085                         y = intersection[2] / intersection[0];
1086                     } else {
1087                         x = Infinity;
1088                     }
1089                 } else if (y > box[1]) { // Intersect with top border
1090                     border = [-box[1], 0, 1];
1091                     intersection = Mat.crossProduct(border, asymptote);
1092                     if (intersection[0] !== 0.0) {
1093                         x = intersection[1] / intersection[0];
1094                         y = intersection[2] / intersection[0];
1095                     } else {
1096                         x = Infinity;
1097                     }
1098                 }
1099             }
1100             return [1, x, y];
1101         },
1102 
1103         /**
1104          * Investigate a function term at the bounds of intervals where
1105          * the function is not defined, e.g. log(x) at x = 0.
1106          *
1107          * c is inbetween a and b
1108          * @private
1109          * @param {Array} a Screen coordinates of the left interval bound
1110          * @param {Array} b Screen coordinates of the right interval bound
1111          * @param {Array} c Screen coordinates of the bisection point at (ta + tb) / 2
1112          * @param {Number} ta Parameter which evaluates to a, i.e. [1, X(ta), Y(ta)] = a in screen coordinates
1113          * @param {Number} tb Parameter which evaluates to b, i.e. [1, X(tb), Y(tb)] = b in screen coordinates
1114          * @param {Number} tc (ta + tb) / 2 = tc. Parameter which evaluates to b, i.e. [1, X(tc), Y(tc)] = c in screen coordinates
1115          * @param {Number} depth Actual recursion depth. The recursion stops if depth is equal to 0.
1116          * @returns {JXG.Boolean} true if the point is inserted and the recursion should stop, false otherwise.
1117          */
1118          _borderCase: function (a, b, c, ta, tb, tc, depth) {
1119              var t, pnt, p,
1120                  p_good = null,
1121                  j,
1122                  max_it = 30,
1123                  is_undef = false,
1124                  t_nan, t_real, t_real2,
1125                  box,
1126                  vx, vy, vx2, vy2, dx, dy,
1127                  asymptote;
1128 
1129 
1130              if (depth <= 1) {
1131                 pnt = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [0, 0], this.board, false);
1132                 j = 0;
1133                 // Bisect a, b and c until the point t_real is inside of the definition interval
1134                 // and as close as possible at the boundary.
1135                 // t_real2 is the second closest point.
1136                 do {
1137                     // There are four cases:
1138                     //  a  |  c  |  b
1139                     // ---------------
1140                     // inf | R   | R
1141                     // R   | R   | inf
1142                     // inf | inf | R
1143                     // R   | inf | inf
1144                     //
1145                     if (isNaN(a[1] + a[2]) && !isNaN(c[1] + c[2])) {
1146                         t_nan = ta;
1147                         t_real = tc;
1148                         t_real2 = tb;
1149                     } else if (isNaN(b[1] + b[2]) && !isNaN(c[1] + c[2])) {
1150                         t_nan = tb;
1151                         t_real = tc;
1152                         t_real2 = ta;
1153                     } else if (isNaN(c[1] + c[2]) && !isNaN(b[1] + b[2])) {
1154                         t_nan = tc;
1155                         t_real = tb;
1156                         t_real2 = tb + (tb - tc);
1157                     } else if (isNaN(c[1] + c[2]) && !isNaN(a[1] + a[2])) {
1158                         t_nan = tc;
1159                         t_real = ta;
1160                         t_real2 = ta - (tc - ta);
1161                     } else {
1162                         return false;
1163                     }
1164                     t = 0.5 * (t_nan + t_real);
1165                     pnt.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(t, true), this.Y(t, true)], false);
1166                     p = pnt.usrCoords;
1167 
1168                     is_undef = isNaN(p[1] + p[2]);
1169                     if (is_undef) {
1170                         t_nan = t;
1171                     } else {
1172                         t_real2 = t_real;
1173                         t_real = t;
1174                     }
1175                     ++j;
1176                 } while (is_undef && j < max_it);
1177 
1178                 // If bisection was successful, take this point.
1179                 // Usefule only for general curves, for function graph
1180                 // the code below overwrite p_good from here.
1181                 if (j < max_it) {
1182                     p_good = p.slice();
1183                     c = p.slice();
1184                     t_real = t;
1185                 }
1186 
1187                 // OK, bisection has been done now.
1188                 // t_real contains the closest inner point to the border of the interval we could find.
1189                 // t_real2 is the second nearest point to this boundary.
1190                 // Now we approximate the derivative by computing the slope of the line through these two points
1191                 // and test if it is "infinite", i.e larger than 400 in absolute values.
1192                 //
1193                 vx = this.X(t_real, true) ;
1194                 vx2 = this.X(t_real2, true) ;
1195                 dx = (vx - vx2) / (t_real - t_real2);
1196                 vy = this.Y(t_real, true) ;
1197                 vy2 = this.Y(t_real2, true) ;
1198                 dy = (vy - vy2) / (t_real - t_real2);
1199 
1200                 // If the derivatives are large enough we draw the asymptote.
1201                 box = this.board.getBoundingBox();
1202                 if (Math.sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy) > 500.0) {
1203 
1204                     // The asymptote is a line of the form
1205                     //  [c, a, b] = [dx * vy - dy * vx, dy, -dx]
1206                     //  Now we have to find the intersection with the correct canvas border.
1207                     asymptote = [dx * vy - dy * vx, dy, -dx];
1208 
1209                     p_good = this._intersectWithBorder(asymptote, box, vx - vx2);
1210                 }
1211 
1212                 if (p_good !== null) {
1213                     this._insertPoint(new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, p_good, this.board, false));
1214                     return true;
1215                 }
1216             }
1217             return false;
1218         },
1219 
1220         /**
1221          * Compute distances in screen coordinates between the points ab,
1222          * ac, cb, and cd, where d = (a + b)/2.
1223          * cd is used for the smoothness test, ab, ac, cb are used to detect jumps, cusps and poles.
1224          *
1225          * @private
1226          * @param {Array} a Screen coordinates of the left interval bound
1227          * @param {Array} b Screen coordinates of the right interval bound
1228          * @param {Array} c Screen coordinates of the bisection point at (ta + tb) / 2
1229          * @returns {Array} array of distances in screen coordinates between: ab, ac, cb, and cd.
1230          */
1231         _triangleDists: function (a, b, c) {
1232             var d, d_ab, d_ac, d_cb, d_cd;
1233 
1234             d = [a[0] * b[0], (a[1] + b[1]) * 0.5, (a[2] + b[2]) * 0.5];
1235 
1236             d_ab = Geometry.distance(a, b, 3);
1237             d_ac = Geometry.distance(a, c, 3);
1238             d_cb = Geometry.distance(c, b, 3);
1239             d_cd = Geometry.distance(c, d, 3);
1240 
1241             return [d_ab, d_ac, d_cb, d_cd];
1242         },
1243 
1244         /**
1245          * Test if the function is undefined on an interval:
1246          * If the interval borders a and b are undefined, 20 random values
1247          * are tested if they are undefined, too.
1248          * Only if all values are undefined, we declare the function to be undefined in this interval.
1249          *
1250          * @private
1251          * @param {Array} a Screen coordinates of the left interval bound
1252          * @param {Number} ta Parameter which evaluates to a, i.e. [1, X(ta), Y(ta)] = a in screen coordinates
1253          * @param {Array} b Screen coordinates of the right interval bound
1254          * @param {Number} tb Parameter which evaluates to b, i.e. [1, X(tb), Y(tb)] = b in screen coordinates
1255          */
1256         _isUndefined: function (a, ta, b, tb) {
1257             var t, i, pnt;
1258 
1259             if (!isNaN(a[1] + a[2]) || !isNaN(b[1] + b[2])) {
1260                 return false;
1261             }
1262 
1263             pnt = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [0, 0], this.board, false);
1264 
1265             for (i = 0; i < 20; ++i) {
1266                 t = ta + Math.random() * (tb - ta);
1267                 pnt.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(t, true), this.Y(t, true)], false);
1268                 if (!isNaN(pnt.scrCoords[0] + pnt.scrCoords[1] + pnt.scrCoords[2])) {
1269                     return false;
1270                 }
1271             }
1272 
1273             return true;
1274         },
1275 
1276         /**
1277          * Decide if a path segment is too far from the canvas that we do not need to draw it.
1278          * @param  {Array}  a  Screen coordinates of the start point of the segment
1279          * @param  {Array}  ta Curve parameter of a.
1280          * @param  {Array}  b  Screen coordinates of the end point of the segment
1281          * @param  {Array}  tb Curve parameter of b.
1282          * @returns {Boolean}   True if the segment is too far away from the canvas, false otherwise.
1283          */
1284         _isOutside: function (a, ta, b, tb) {
1285             var off = 500,
1286                 cw = this.board.canvasWidth,
1287                 ch = this.board.canvasHeight;
1288 
1289             return !!((a[1] < -off && b[1] < -off) ||
1290                 (a[2] < -off && b[2] < -off) ||
1291                 (a[1] > cw + off && b[1] > cw + off) ||
1292                 (a[2] > ch + off && b[2] > ch + off));
1293         },
1294 
1295         /**
1296          * Recursive interval bisection algorithm for curve plotting.
1297          * Used in {@link JXG.Curve.updateParametricCurve}.
1298          * @private
1299          * @param {Array} a Screen coordinates of the left interval bound
1300          * @param {Number} ta Parameter which evaluates to a, i.e. [1, X(ta), Y(ta)] = a in screen coordinates
1301          * @param {Array} b Screen coordinates of the right interval bound
1302          * @param {Number} tb Parameter which evaluates to b, i.e. [1, X(tb), Y(tb)] = b in screen coordinates
1303          * @param {Number} depth Actual recursion depth. The recursion stops if depth is equal to 0.
1304          * @param {Number} delta If the distance of the bisection point at (ta + tb) / 2 from the point (a + b) / 2 is less then delta,
1305          *                 the segment [a,b] is regarded as straight line.
1306          * @returns {JXG.Curve} Reference to the curve object.
1307          */
1308         _plotRecursive: function (a, ta, b, tb, depth, delta) {
1309             var tc, c,
1310                 ds, mindepth = 0,
1311                 isSmooth, isJump, isCusp,
1312                 cusp_threshold = 0.5,
1313                 pnt = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [0, 0], this.board, false);
1314 
1315             if (this.numberPoints > 65536) {
1316                 return;
1317             }
1318 
1319             // Test if the function is undefined on an interval
1320             if (depth < this.nanLevel && this._isUndefined(a, ta, b, tb)) {
1321                 return this;
1322             }
1323 
1324             if (depth < this.nanLevel && this._isOutside(a, ta, b, tb)) {
1325                 return this;
1326             }
1327 
1328             tc = 0.5 * (ta  + tb);
1329             pnt.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(tc, true), this.Y(tc, true)], false);
1330             c = pnt.scrCoords;
1331 
1332             if (this._borderCase(a, b, c, ta, tb, tc, depth)) {
1333                 return this;
1334             }
1335 
1336             ds = this._triangleDists(a, b, c);           // returns [d_ab, d_ac, d_cb, d_cd]
1337             isSmooth = (depth < this.smoothLevel) && (ds[3] < delta);
1338 
1339             isJump = (depth < this.jumpLevel) &&
1340                         ((ds[2] > 0.99 * ds[0]) || (ds[1] > 0.99 * ds[0]) ||
1341                         ds[0] === Infinity || ds[1] === Infinity || ds[2] === Infinity);
1342             isCusp = (depth < this.smoothLevel + 2) && (ds[0] < cusp_threshold * (ds[1] + ds[2]));
1343 
1344             if (isCusp) {
1345                 mindepth = 0;
1346                 isSmooth = false;
1347             }
1348 
1349             --depth;
1350 
1351             if (isJump) {
1352                 this._insertPoint(new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, [NaN, NaN], this.board, false), tc);
1353             } else if (depth <= mindepth || isSmooth) {
1354                 this._insertPoint(pnt, tc);
1355                 //if (this._borderCase(a, b, c, ta, tb, tc, depth)) {}
1356             } else {
1357                 this._plotRecursive(a, ta, c, tc, depth, delta);
1358                 this._insertPoint(pnt, tc);
1359                 this._plotRecursive(c, tc, b, tb, depth, delta);
1360             }
1361 
1362             return this;
1363         },
1364 
1365         /**
1366          * Updates the data points of a parametric curve. This version is used if {@link JXG.Curve#doadvancedplot} is <tt>true</tt>.
1367          * @param {Number} mi Left bound of curve
1368          * @param {Number} ma Right bound of curve
1369          * @returns {JXG.Curve} Reference to the curve object.
1370          */
1371         updateParametricCurve: function (mi, ma) {
1372             var ta, tb, a, b,
1373                 suspendUpdate = false,
1374                 pa = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [0, 0], this.board, false),
1375                 pb = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [0, 0], this.board, false),
1376                 depth, delta;
1377 
1378             if (this.board.updateQuality === this.board.BOARD_QUALITY_LOW) {
1379                 depth = Type.evaluate(this.visProp.recursiondepthlow) || 13;
1380                 delta = 2;
1381                 this.smoothLevel = 5; //depth - 7;
1382                 this.jumpLevel = 5;
1383             } else {
1384                 depth = Type.evaluate(this.visProp.recursiondepthhigh) || 17;
1385                 delta = 2;
1386                 // smoothLevel has to be small for graphs in a huge interval.
1387                 this.smoothLevel = 3; //depth - 7; // 9
1388                 this.jumpLevel = 3;
1389             }
1390             this.nanLevel = depth - 4;
1391 
1392             this.points = [];
1393 
1394             ta = mi;
1395             pa.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(ta, suspendUpdate), this.Y(ta, suspendUpdate)], false);
1396             a = pa.copy('scrCoords');
1397             suspendUpdate = true;
1398 
1399             tb = ma;
1400             pb.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [this.X(tb, suspendUpdate), this.Y(tb, suspendUpdate)], false);
1401             b = pb.copy('scrCoords');
1402 
1403             pa._t = ta;
1404             this.points.push(pa);
1405             this._lastCrds = pa.copy('scrCoords');   //Used in _insertPoint
1406             this._plotRecursive(a, ta, b, tb, depth, delta);
1407             pb._t = tb;
1408             this.points.push(pb);
1409 
1410             this.numberPoints = this.points.length;
1411 
1412             return this;
1413         },
1414 
1415         /**
1416          * Applies the transformations of the curve to the given point <tt>p</tt>.
1417          * Before using it, {@link JXG.Curve#updateTransformMatrix} has to be called.
1418          * @param {JXG.Point} p
1419          * @returns {JXG.Point} The given point.
1420          */
1421         updateTransform: function (p) {
1422             var c,
1423                 len = this.transformations.length;
1424 
1425             if (len > 0) {
1426                 c = Mat.matVecMult(this.transformMat, p.usrCoords);
1427                 p.setCoordinates(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, [c[1], c[2]], false, true);
1428             }
1429 
1430             return p;
1431         },
1432 
1433         /**
1434          * Add transformations to this curve.
1435          * @param {JXG.Transformation|Array} transform Either one {@link JXG.Transformation} or an array of {@link JXG.Transformation}s.
1436          * @returns {JXG.Curve} Reference to the curve object.
1437          */
1438         addTransform: function (transform) {
1439             var i,
1440                 list = Type.isArray(transform) ? transform : [transform],
1441                 len = list.length;
1442 
1443             for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
1444                 this.transformations.push(list[i]);
1445             }
1446 
1447             return this;
1448         },
1449 
1450         /**
1451          * Generate the method curve.X() in case curve.dataX is an array
1452          * and generate the method curve.Y() in case curve.dataY is an array.
1453          * @private
1454          * @param {String} which Either 'X' or 'Y'
1455          * @returns {function}
1456          **/
1457         interpolationFunctionFromArray: function (which) {
1458             var data = 'data' + which;
1459 
1460             return function (t, suspendedUpdate) {
1461                 var i, j, t0, t1,
1462                     arr = this[data],
1463                     len = arr.length,
1464                     f = [];
1465 
1466                 if (isNaN(t)) {
1467                     return NaN;
1468                 }
1469 
1470                 if (t < 0) {
1471                     if (Type.isFunction(arr[0])) {
1472                         return arr[0]();
1473                     }
1474 
1475                     return arr[0];
1476                 }
1477 
1478                 if (this.bezierDegree === 3) {
1479                     len /= 3;
1480                     if (t >= len) {
1481                         if (Type.isFunction(arr[arr.length - 1])) {
1482                             return arr[arr.length - 1]();
1483                         }
1484 
1485                         return arr[arr.length - 1];
1486                     }
1487 
1488                     i = Math.floor(t) * 3;
1489                     t0 = t % 1;
1490                     t1 = 1 - t0;
1491 
1492                     for (j = 0; j < 4; j++) {
1493                         if (Type.isFunction(arr[i + j])) {
1494                             f[j] = arr[i + j]();
1495                         } else {
1496                             f[j] = arr[i + j];
1497                         }
1498                     }
1499 
1500                     return t1 * t1 * (t1 * f[0] + 3 * t0 * f[1]) + (3 * t1 * f[2] + t0 * f[3]) * t0 * t0;
1501                 }
1502 
1503                 if (t > len - 2) {
1504                     i = len - 2;
1505                 } else {
1506                     i = parseInt(Math.floor(t), 10);
1507                 }
1508 
1509                 if (i === t) {
1510                     if (Type.isFunction(arr[i])) {
1511                         return arr[i]();
1512                     }
1513                     return arr[i];
1514                 }
1515 
1516                 for (j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
1517                     if (Type.isFunction(arr[i + j])) {
1518                         f[j] = arr[i + j]();
1519                     } else {
1520                         f[j] = arr[i + j];
1521                     }
1522                 }
1523                 return f[0] + (f[1] - f[0]) * (t - i);
1524             };
1525         },
1526 
1527         /**
1528          * Converts the GEONExT syntax of the defining function term into JavaScript.
1529          * New methods X() and Y() for the Curve object are generated, further
1530          * new methods for minX() and maxX().
1531          * @see JXG.GeonextParser.geonext2JS.
1532          */
1533         generateTerm: function (varname, xterm, yterm, mi, ma) {
1534             var fx, fy;
1535 
1536             // Generate the methods X() and Y()
1537             if (Type.isArray(xterm)) {
1538                 // Discrete data
1539                 this.dataX = xterm;
1540 
1541                 this.numberPoints = this.dataX.length;
1542                 this.X = this.interpolationFunctionFromArray('X');
1543                 this.visProp.curvetype = 'plot';
1544                 this.isDraggable = true;
1545             } else {
1546                 // Continuous data
1547                 this.X = Type.createFunction(xterm, this.board, varname);
1548                 if (Type.isString(xterm)) {
1549                     this.visProp.curvetype = 'functiongraph';
1550                 } else if (Type.isFunction(xterm) || Type.isNumber(xterm)) {
1551                     this.visProp.curvetype = 'parameter';
1552                 }
1553 
1554                 this.isDraggable = true;
1555             }
1556 
1557             if (Type.isArray(yterm)) {
1558                 this.dataY = yterm;
1559                 this.Y = this.interpolationFunctionFromArray('Y');
1560             } else {
1561                 this.Y = Type.createFunction(yterm, this.board, varname);
1562             }
1563 
1564             /**
1565              * Polar form
1566              * Input data is function xterm() and offset coordinates yterm
1567              */
1568             if (Type.isFunction(xterm) && Type.isArray(yterm)) {
1569                 // Xoffset, Yoffset
1570                 fx = Type.createFunction(yterm[0], this.board, '');
1571                 fy = Type.createFunction(yterm[1], this.board, '');
1572 
1573                 this.X = function (phi) {
1574                     return xterm(phi) * Math.cos(phi) + fx();
1575                 };
1576 
1577                 this.Y = function (phi) {
1578                     return xterm(phi) * Math.sin(phi) + fy();
1579                 };
1580 
1581                 this.visProp.curvetype = 'polar';
1582             }
1583 
1584             // Set the bounds lower bound
1585             if (Type.exists(mi)) {
1586                 this.minX = Type.createFunction(mi, this.board, '');
1587             }
1588             if (Type.exists(ma)) {
1589                 this.maxX = Type.createFunction(ma, this.board, '');
1590             }
1591         },
1592 
1593         /**
1594          * Finds dependencies in a given term and notifies the parents by adding the
1595          * dependent object to the found objects child elements.
1596          * @param {String} contentStr String containing dependencies for the given object.
1597          */
1598         notifyParents: function (contentStr) {
1599             var fstr, dep,
1600                 isJessieCode = false,
1601                 obj;
1602 
1603             // Read dependencies found by the JessieCode parser
1604             obj = {'xterm': 1, 'yterm': 1};
1605             for (fstr in obj) {
1606                 if (obj.hasOwnProperty(fstr) && this.hasOwnProperty(fstr) && this[fstr].origin) {
1607                     isJessieCode = true;
1608                     for (dep in this[fstr].origin.deps) {
1609                         if (this[fstr].origin.deps.hasOwnProperty(dep)) {
1610                             this[fstr].origin.deps[dep].addChild(this);
1611                         }
1612                     }
1613                 }
1614             }
1615 
1616             if (!isJessieCode) {
1617                 GeonextParser.findDependencies(this, contentStr, this.board);
1618             }
1619         },
1620 
1621         // documented in geometry element
1622         getLabelAnchor: function () {
1623             var c, x, y,
1624                 ax = 0.05 * this.board.canvasWidth,
1625                 ay = 0.05 * this.board.canvasHeight,
1626                 bx = 0.95 * this.board.canvasWidth,
1627                 by = 0.95 * this.board.canvasHeight;
1628 
1629             switch (Type.evaluate(this.visProp.label.position)) {
1630             case 'ulft':
1631                 x = ax;
1632                 y = ay;
1633                 break;
1634             case 'llft':
1635                 x = ax;
1636                 y = by;
1637                 break;
1638             case 'rt':
1639                 x = bx;
1640                 y = 0.5 * by;
1641                 break;
1642             case 'lrt':
1643                 x = bx;
1644                 y = by;
1645                 break;
1646             case 'urt':
1647                 x = bx;
1648                 y = ay;
1649                 break;
1650             case 'top':
1651                 x = 0.5 * bx;
1652                 y = ay;
1653                 break;
1654             case 'bot':
1655                 x = 0.5 * bx;
1656                 y = by;
1657                 break;
1658             default:
1659                 // includes case 'lft'
1660                 x = ax;
1661                 y = 0.5 * by;
1662             }
1663 
1664             c = new Coords(Const.COORDS_BY_SCREEN, [x, y], this.board, false);
1665             return Geometry.projectCoordsToCurve(c.usrCoords[1], c.usrCoords[2], 0, this, this.board)[0];
1666         },
1667 
1668         // documented in geometry element
1669         cloneToBackground: function () {
1670             var er,
1671                 copy = {
1672                     id: this.id + 'T' + this.numTraces,
1673                     elementClass: Const.OBJECT_CLASS_CURVE,
1674 
1675                     points: this.points.slice(0),
1676                     bezierDegree: this.bezierDegree,
1677                     numberPoints: this.numberPoints,
1678                     board: this.board,
1679                     visProp: Type.deepCopy(this.visProp, this.visProp.traceattributes, true)
1680                 };
1681 
1682             copy.visProp.layer = this.board.options.layer.trace;
1683             copy.visProp.curvetype = this.visProp.curvetype;
1684             this.numTraces++;
1685 
1686             Type.clearVisPropOld(copy);
1687             copy.visPropCalc = {
1688                 visible: Type.evaluate(copy.visProp.visible)
1689             };
1690             er = this.board.renderer.enhancedRendering;
1691             this.board.renderer.enhancedRendering = true;
1692             this.board.renderer.drawCurve(copy);
1693             this.board.renderer.enhancedRendering = er;
1694             this.traces[copy.id] = copy.rendNode;
1695 
1696             return this;
1697         },
1698 
1699         // already documented in GeometryElement
1700         bounds: function () {
1701             var minX = Infinity, maxX = -Infinity, minY = Infinity, maxY = -Infinity,
1702                 l = this.points.length, i,
1703                 bezier, up;
1704 
1705             if (this.bezierDegree === 3) {
1706                 // Add methods X(), Y()
1707                 for (i = 0; i < l; i++) {
1708                     this.points[i].X = Type.bind(function() { return this.usrCoords[1]; }, this.points[i]);
1709                     this.points[i].Y = Type.bind(function() { return this.usrCoords[2]; }, this.points[i]);
1710                 }
1711                 bezier = Numerics.bezier(this.points);
1712                 up = bezier[3]();
1713                 minX = Numerics.fminbr(function(t) { return bezier[0](t); }, [0, up]);
1714                 maxX = Numerics.fminbr(function(t) { return -bezier[0](t); }, [0, up]);
1715                 minY = Numerics.fminbr(function(t) { return bezier[1](t); }, [0, up]);
1716                 maxY = Numerics.fminbr(function(t) { return -bezier[1](t); }, [0, up]);
1717 
1718                 minX = bezier[0](minX);
1719                 maxX = bezier[0](maxX);
1720                 minY = bezier[1](minY);
1721                 maxY = bezier[1](maxY);
1722                 return [minX, maxY, maxX, minY];
1723             }
1724 
1725             // Linear segments
1726             for (i = 0; i < l; i++) {
1727                 if (minX > this.points[i].usrCoords[1]) {
1728                     minX = this.points[i].usrCoords[1];
1729                 }
1730 
1731                 if (maxX < this.points[i].usrCoords[1]) {
1732                     maxX = this.points[i].usrCoords[1];
1733                 }
1734 
1735                 if (minY > this.points[i].usrCoords[2]) {
1736                     minY = this.points[i].usrCoords[2];
1737                 }
1738 
1739                 if (maxY < this.points[i].usrCoords[2]) {
1740                     maxY = this.points[i].usrCoords[2];
1741                 }
1742             }
1743 
1744             return [minX, maxY, maxX, minY];
1745         },
1746 
1747         // documented in element.js
1748         getParents: function () {
1749             var p = [this.xterm, this.yterm, this.minX(), this.maxX()];
1750 
1751             if (this.parents.length !== 0) {
1752                 p = this.parents;
1753             }
1754 
1755             return p;
1756         },
1757 
1758         /**
1759          * Shift the curve by the vector 'where'.
1760          *
1761          * @param {Array} where Array containing the x and y coordinate of the target location.
1762          * @returns {JXG.Curve} Reference to itself.
1763          */
1764         moveTo: function(where) {
1765             // TODO add animation
1766             var delta = [], p;
1767             if (this.points.length > 0 && !Type.evaluate(this.visProp.fixed)) {
1768                 p = this.points[0];
1769                 if (where.length === 3) {
1770                     delta = [where[0] - p.usrCoords[0],
1771                             where[1] - p.usrCoords[1],
1772                             where[2] - p.usrCoords[2]];
1773                 } else {
1774                     delta = [where[0] - p.usrCoords[1],
1775                             where[1] - p.usrCoords[2]];
1776                 }
1777                 this.setPosition(Const.COORDS_BY_USER, delta);
1778             }
1779             return this;
1780         }
1781     });
1782 
1783 
1784     /**
1785      * @class This element is used to provide a constructor for curve, which is just a wrapper for element {@link Curve}.
1786      * A curve is a mapping from R to R^2. t mapsto (x(t),y(t)). The graph is drawn for t in the interval [a,b].
1787      * <p>
1788      * The following types of curves can be plotted:
1789      * <ul>
1790      *  <li> parametric curves: t mapsto (x(t),y(t)), where x() and y() are univariate functions.
1791      *  <li> polar curves: curves commonly written with polar equations like spirals and cardioids.
1792      *  <li> data plots: plot line segments through a given list of coordinates.
1793      * </ul>
1794      * @pseudo
1795      * @description
1796      * @name Curve
1797      * @augments JXG.Curve
1798      * @constructor
1799      * @type JXG.Curve
1800      *
1801      * @param {function,number_function,number_function,number_function,number} x,y,a_,b_ Parent elements for Parametric Curves.
1802      *                     <p>
1803      *                     x describes the x-coordinate of the curve. It may be a function term in one variable, e.g. x(t).
1804      *                     In case of x being of type number, x(t) is set to  a constant function.
1805      *                     this function at the values of the array.
1806      *                     </p>
1807      *                     <p>
1808      *                     y describes the y-coordinate of the curve. In case of a number, y(t) is set to the constant function
1809      *                     returning this number.
1810      *                     </p>
1811      *                     <p>
1812      *                     Further parameters are an optional number or function for the left interval border a,
1813      *                     and an optional number or function for the right interval border b.
1814      *                     </p>
1815      *                     <p>
1816      *                     Default values are a=-10 and b=10.
1817      *                     </p>
1818      * @param {array_array,function,number} x,y Parent elements for Data Plots.
1819      *                     <p>
1820      *                     x and y are arrays contining the x and y coordinates of the data points which are connected by
1821      *                     line segments. The individual entries of x and y may also be functions.
1822      *                     In case of x being an array the curve type is data plot, regardless of the second parameter and
1823      *                     if additionally the second parameter y is a function term the data plot evaluates.
1824      *                     </p>
1825      * @param {function_array,function,number_function,number_function,number} r,offset_,a_,b_ Parent elements for Polar Curves.
1826      *                     <p>
